thread.title_full: Hope House to close by next October if they don't have a partner | Local News | foxbangor.com

title: Hope House to close by next October if they don't have a partner | Local News | foxbangor.com
text:
BANGOR -- The Hope House could be closing by next October if it does not find a new partner.
The announcement was made by Penobscot Community Health Care President Lori Dwyer.
P.C.H.C. has been running the shelter for nearly 13 years since taking it over from Acadia Hospital in 2011.
The Hope House offers a variety of services, including health care for the homeless, mental health and transitional housing.
Dwyer says the organization is actively looking for a partner while navigating the challenges of finding funding.
"We wanted to give ourselves enough of a runway to be able to really have those important conversations and work really hard to identify additional funding resources because a partner organization is going to have similar challenges to us," said Dwyer.
Dwyer says funding has always been an issue, with the need has been growing rapidly.
Should the Hope House close, Dwyer says the health care and transitional housing for the homeless will remain operational under P.C.H.C.
Dwyer says conversations with potential partners have gone well so far and remains optimistic the shelter will continue to be open for the foreseeable future.
Upon finding its new partner, P.C.H.C. will continue to operate the transitional housing part of the campus, while the new partner will deal with the daily operations of the hope house.
